# ⭐️ How to Set Up to Run on Your Account
**Author:** Don Lyons from [Effortless Digital](https://www.instagram.com/effortlessdigitaldon/)  

This quick-start guide shows you how to set up your account to work with OpenAI for images and content, and ConvertAPI to get the final output in .docx format.

## 🔳 Step 1: Set Up OpenAI for Content & Image Generation
**Cost Note:** OpenAI's API will cost around 0.25 for each completed PDF product, Bonus Idea doc and Ecover Image. _Definitely beats 2hrs doing it yourself_

1. Go to [OpenAI API Platform](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)  
2. Create an account (if you don’t have one).  
3. Generate an API key.  
4. Create a credential using that key.  
**Note:** If you use the 4o image generation model, OpenAI will ask you to verify your identity. They do this to prevent misuse.

## 🔳 Step 2: Set Up ConvertAPI (for DOCX Conversion)
1.  **Go to:** [ConvertAPI Website](https://www.convertapi.com/)
2.  **Sign Up:** Create a free account.
3.  **Find API Secret:** After signing up, navigate to "Authentication -> Secret Key". You should find your "API Secret" (it starts with secret).
4.  **Add to n8n:** In n8n, go to "Credentials" > "New". Search for "ConvertAPI" and create a new credential. Paste your API Secret into the appropriate field. Give it a name.

**Note:** ConvertAPI's free tier limit is 250 runs. For extensive use, you might need a paid plan. This workflow uses it to convert HTML to DOCX. You get 250 runs for free.

## 🔳 Step 3: Set Up Cloudinary (Image Uploading Tool)
**Cost Note:** FREE (free plan lets you upload 1,000s of images each month)

### 1. Create Your Free Account
- Go to: https://cloudinary.com/users/register_free
- Sign up for a free account

### 2. Get Your Cloud Name
- Log into your Cloudinary dashboard
- Find your **Cloud Name** at the top of the dashboard
- **Copy this name** - you'll need it in step 5

### 3. Create an Upload Preset
- Click the **Settings** gear icon (bottom left)
- Navigate to the **Upload** tab
- Click **"+ Add upload preset"**
- Configure the preset:
  - Change **Signing Mode** from "Signed" to **"Unsigned"**
  - Set **Preset name** to: `aiasset_preset`
  - Leave all other settings as default
  - Click **Save**

### 4. Update the n8n Workflow
In your n8n workflow, find the **"Get Img Link"** node and:
- Replace `YOUR_CLOUD_NAME` in the URL with your actual Cloud Name from step 2
- The URL should look like:
https://api.cloudinary.com/v1_1/doryejrxy/image/upload
But with YOUR cloud name instead of "doodyyrxy"

### 5. Test Your Setup
- The workflow is now ready to upload images to your Cloudinary account
- Each uploaded image will get a unique URL that the workflow uses for the ebook cover

**Note:** Make sure your upload preset name is exactly `aiasset_preset` or the workflow won't work!
